localized title: Kaun Hai Jo Sapno Mein Aaya
plot outline: Of Indian origin; Sunny Khanna, a struggling actor; is settled in Britain with his huge family consisting of his dad, Kuldeep, his mom, his siblings and other family members. Kuldeep's friend, Dr. Verma seeks his permission for his niece, Mahek to take up lodging with the Khanna's for a month until he attends a conference in the U.S, to which Kuldeep accepts. Upon Mahek's arrival she greets a dysfunctional family and attempts to change this by first assisting Sunny in pulling together his acting career, teaching Mrs. Khanna and her daughter in law to pay due respects to elders as well as up-heeding various religious practices of the Hindu religion with the first being Karva Chauth. Mahek also assists Jash Khanna in coping with the loss of his wife, Christine and son Tobey in an accident by overcoming his alcoholism. By this time Sunny has fallen deeply in love with Mahek but a confession leads to rejection breaking hearts. The real reason behind this rejection will comes to light upon the passing away of Sunny's grandmother changing the lives of the Khanna's forever.

Kuldeep Khanna leads a comfortable lifestyle in Britain along with his wife, mom, a son, Sunny; and several other relatives. One day his friend from India, Dr. Verma, asks him to look after his niece, Mahek, for about a month, while he must attend a conference in the U.S.A., to which Kuldeep agrees to. Mahek moves into the Khanna household and notices that the family is dysfunctional. She begins to reform the youngest one, Sweety, and succeeds considerably. Then she teaches Kuldeep's wife and sister-in-laws how to respect her elderly mother-in-law, and follow the Hindu traditions, especially pertaining to religion and Karva Chauth. Mahek then helps Jash Khanna overcome his alcoholism and seek peace with himself after losing his wife, Christine, and son, Tobey, in an accident. It is then Mahek finds out that Sunny is in love with her and wants to marry her. She flatly turns him down, telling him that there is someone else in her life. This upsets Sunny, and does not go unnoticed by his grandma, who asks Mahek what the reason is. Mahek speaks in confidence with grandma, and shortly thereafter grandma suddenly dies. Watch as events unfold with Mahek getting instantly unpopular with the Khannas and the real reason why Mahek refused to marry Sunny.::rAjOo (gunwanti@hotmail.com)
